title: Report: Chargers S Phillips breaks forearm
text:
Sep 15, 2019; Detroit, MI, USA; Los Angeles Chargers defensive back Adrian Phillips (31) walks off the field after an injury during the second half against the Detroit Lions at Ford Field. Mandatory Credit: Tim Fuller-USA TODAY Sports

Los Angeles Chargers safety Adrian Phillips broke his forearm during Sunday’s 13-10 loss to the Detroit Lions, ESPN’s Adam Schefter reported.

Phillips, 27, is in his sixth season with the Chargers. He is expected to be out indefinitely.

He started the first two weeks in place of Derwin James, who sustained a stress fracture in his foot in training camp.

In two games this year, Phillips has 14 tackles.

—Field Level Media
description: Los Angeles Chargers safety Adrian Phillips broke his forearm during Sunday's 13-10 loss to the Detroit Lions, ESPN's Adam Schefter reported.
